note.p: Career: One of the founders, with Justus van Effen (FRS 1715) and Willem Jakob 's Gravesande (FRS 1715), of the 'Journal litteraire de La Haye'; travelled to France (1713, 1717) and England (1719); Counsellor to the Prince of Orange (1716); Auditor Surveyor to the Bank of Holland (1717); attended the Congress of Kamerijk [?Cambrai] (1723)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll (from Zedler); Biographie Universelle (1825); NNBW
References: A Rupert Hall, 'Further Newton Correspondence' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 7-34
